Assassin's creed valhalla. I was disappointed from it because of the too much glitches in it. Every quest i played i face glitches and the quest was very similar to each other leading to be bored from the game beacuse i expected from it a lot before playing it.

League of legends is cool because it requires strategic thinking and team tactics.
Jett: The Far Shore is thrilling when you're flying through the air, but boring puzzles and an unsatisfying conclusion keeps it from soaring.
No More Heroes 3 is at its best when you're slicing your way through alien invaders, but the rest of the game wrapped around the energetic combat is a laborious disappointment.
Psychonauts 2 does more than just fill the shoes of its beloved quirky predecessor, it sets itself apart as a classic in its own right.

Square Enix tells a smaller, more personal Final Fantasy 7 tale and marries it with a smart mashup of action and RPG gameplay to deliver a must-play experience. Its PS5 version realizes the world of Midgar with stunning new detail
Stonefly is too weighed down by unwieldy combat and grind to get off the ground.
Hood gives you glimpses of a new and exciting multiplayer concept, but its many, many design flaws keep the game from delivering.
Balan Wonderworld is an occasionally inspired, often unimaginative platformer lost to time.
Monster Hunter Rise's renewed focus on fully-fledged action represents the series at the peak of its powers.
Ghosts 'n Goblins Resurrection is an honest, faithful homage to a series known for being so difficult, it's nearly unplayable
Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury packages one of the best recent Mario games with a delightfully odd new experience.
Persona 5's RPG elements thrive in action-based combat, and while the story may not hit hard, the Phantom Thieves haven't forgotten what they're about.
he Medium is a terrifying but compelling exploration of duality that uses the horror of personal trauma to craft a memorable tale.
Tetris Effect: Connected extends the magic of the original to multiplayer in familiar and innovative ways.
Godfall's monotonous structure is held together by punchy combat that can't bear the full weight.
just started this awesome game @[gamename] definitely recommended
One of Wii U's earliest gems remains a delight to play on Nintendo Switch.
Ring of Pain can be frustrating in its difficulty, but more often than not, it's satisfying and wonderfully creepy.
The reason to keep coming back to Hades isn't just the thrills you'll get battling through hell, but the characters and stories you learn about along the way.
Exciting and stressful in the way all good twitch-action games are, Disc Room makes you cherish every second you manage to survive in its sawblade-filled stages.
The frequent lulls of its road trip, coupled with a monotonous roster of characters, means this driving sim should be left in the dust.

Undercover Game: simply it divides players to 3 teams: 1 Undercover, 1 white player & the rest are citizens

The game shows 2 similar words for both the citizens and the undercover (like: onion and garlic) and the white players doesn't get any word

Each round, each player should give a hint about the word he/she saw making sure not to expose it to the undercover 

Then we all vote on each other, the one who gets the most got will be eliminated

If the eliminated person is the undercover, then all the other players win
If the eliminated person is the white, he/she gets the chance to guess the word, if guessed correctly, the white player wins

If the undercover hasn‚Äôt been eliminated till the last round, he/she wins

The assassin's creed franchise is losing track of what it used to be, Ubisoft is focused on introducing RPG elements and making the open world bigger with every installment, yet there is not enough concentration on the main story itself, making the gamers feel they are not even playing an assassin's creed game, the modern world story is not as captivating as Desmond Miles' arc and Leila, Desmond's modern replacement, is not even as relatable.
Ubisoft needs to review their previous installments in the franchise in order to keep track of what gave it its value in the first place.
I love this game so much. I can play it all the time. It learns me how to play in team. And how to gain it is a super game

Sam Raimi's Spider-Man trilogy is the perfect adaptation of the hero's story. The way it focuses on the moral aspects of power,responsibilty,forgiveness and other characteristic traits of the web-slinger is amazing.
Peter Parker is relatable all through the three installements, Aunt May is the old family figure that a young conflicted man would truly look up to, and Danny Elfman's score perfectly translates peter's conflicted emotions and sense of responsibility.
The trilogy played an amazing role in shaping the superhero genre.
